chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:
items.plainText: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:

items.text: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.
items.plainText: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

items.text: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:
items.plainText: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:

items.text: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
items.plainText: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

items.text: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.
items.plainText: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

items.text: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
items.plainText: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

items.text: Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.
items.plainText: Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.

items.text: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.
items.plainText: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

items.text: Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
items.plainText: Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

items.text: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.
items.plainText: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.

items.text: My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:
items.plainText: My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:

items.text: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.
items.plainText: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

items.text: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.
items.plainText: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

items.text: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.
items.plainText: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

items.text: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.
items.plainText: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.

items.text: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.
items.plainText: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.

items.text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.
items.plainText: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

items.text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.
items.plainText: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.

items.text: The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.
items.plainText: The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.

items.text: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.
items.plainText: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

items.text: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:
items.plainText: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

items.text: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.
items.plainText: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

items.text: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.
items.plainText: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

items.text: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
items.plainText: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

items.text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.
items.plainText: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.

items.text: For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
items.plainText: For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.

items.text: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.
items.plainText: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.

items.text: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.
items.plainText: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

items.text: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
items.plainText: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

items.text: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
items.plainText: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

items.text: Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.
items.plainText: Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

items.text: For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.
items.plainText: For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.

items.text: The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.
items.plainText: The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.

items.text: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.
items.plainText: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

items.text: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
items.plainText: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
